title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19 §§ 197-3.13 - Suspensions and denials of school approval
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19 §§ 197-3.13 - Suspensions and denials of school approval

State Regulations

The Department of State may deny, suspend or revoke the
approval of a home inspection school, if it is determined that they are not in
compliance with the law and rules. If disciplinary action is taken, a written
order of suspension, revocation, or denial of approval will be issued. Anyone
who objects to such denial, suspension or revocation shall have the opportunity
to be heard by the Secretary of State or his or her designee pursuant to Real

Property Law section 444-i. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19
§§
197-3.13

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
